website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for jobs that require well-angled pocket holes for large pieces, but may not suit your needs if you want a more comprehensive and versatile system.
pros: Ideal for specific needs – works well with 2x4' and larger wood planks
Has hardened steel drill guides and accurate pocket-hole measure
cons: Not as many pieces as other systems, but you may not need all of the extras
Not practical for small woodworking projects

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for building our farmhouse table!
customer_reviews.text: This Jig is awesome. It was perfect for building our Farmhouse Table. Other options are not made for thicker pieces of wood like the 4x4 and we didn't want to risk not having a good solid pocket hole joint. The HD screws that come with this are thicker and longer than come with the other options. We used this device to attach the entire base (4x4 beams) and to attach the top together (2x8 boards). We used a clamp to hold this device to the wood. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: JakeNLeelo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool. Used it to build shelving constructed from ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tool. Used it to build shelving constructed from 2x4's in my garage. Worked brilliantly. Make sure you check the Kreg web site for information on the load bearing capacity of pocket hole joints. They are strong enough for many applications, but the orientation of the joint (i.e. the direction of the screws) relative to the direction of the load can make a big difference in the strength of the joint, so if you're building something that will bear a load (like a shelf), check the data.
customer_reviews.author: ManBehindTheCurtain

customer_reviews.title: Drill bit broke first project
customer_reviews.text: Drill bit broke off drill for first time project using it into cedar (which isn't even a hard wood) and was stuck into the wood causing the cut Cedar to be useless. Very expensive break down! I cannot understand how this could have broke. I was using the kreg clamp and following directions completely! Amazon did offer to replace item which was very nice but we are still disappointed this broke and slowed the project down while waiting on a new one.
customer_reviews.author: michigan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good if you need it, but might not be worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I used this to build kitchen table supports with some 4x4s. It worked pretty well, but is a bit difficult to get into place compared with the normal Kreg Jig. However, I felt like the cost didn't justify the additional benefit I got from it's use. If you are going to be drilling a lot of 4x4s and larger lumber then pick this up. Otherwise, maybe just stick to the regular jig.
customer_reviews.author: Crugen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome jig for farmhouse table
customer_reviews.text: Read some reviews and decided to bite the bullet and purchase this to construct a farmhouse table. So glad I did. I still used bar clamps but only to hold in place until I got the pocket hole screws in place, then I could pop the clamp off, glue the next board and tighten in place. Final product turned out great and is rock solid. Would highly recommend this for any project that requires neat/discreet joining of 2X materials. I used ipe for project. Harder than mahogany. Would recommend holding shopvac over the sawdust holes if using on hard wood and/or continuous use. Made a huge difference in heat dissipation.
customer_reviews.author: DW in TN

customer_reviews.title: Works great, love the HD screws!
customer_reviews.text: This device allowed this homeowner to build some STRONG garage shelves. I love the simplicity of the jig and the results speak for themselves. Easy, quick and awesome. I used a screw to hold the jig securely to my 2x4 and ran the drill on high speed into both ports. Plan on buying more of the HD Screws with the square bit head as they are so much nicer than Phillips head screws, they simply do not slip (thus no stripped screws)! You drive it into the pocket you made and It's secured. BTW, the screws pictured on KREG's site show Phillips heads, but they are actual square bit. I've asked them to update their site photo.
customer_reviews.author: 1inTexas

customer_reviews.title: 5 star tool. 1 star quality
customer_reviews.text: As far as the tool goes. It's a must have. I used it to join 4x4s and it's easy to use and makes the joints very strong. Easily a 5 star product. But after one project my drill bit already snapped. Even still, I highly recommend buying this tool. But buy a spare bit right away. And also the hd screws, because you wont find them at any store
customer_reviews.author: marco macias

customer_reviews.title: Defective drill bit
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this pocket hole tool is great however I was unlucky to get a defective drill bit. I hope thats the case because a drill bit should last longer than few holes... all my basic bits have lasted for years. Basically after a few holes this bit went blunt and now drilling a hole takes several times longer and a LOT of effort. Had to order a replacement hoping to get decent drill bit.
customer_reviews.author: Artur

customer_reviews.title: Gets The Job Done
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! Made the job of building stairs to join our 2 of 6 decks on the house together a little more time consuming, but less hastle. The smooth plastic makes the tool easily slide when the drill torques the bit. Had to hold the top of the jig steady even though I used my kung fu ninja grip to tighten the clamp ;-) The kit comes with 10 hard-to-find-at-the-hardware-store pocket screws. They are super heavy duty, so I will invest in theirs.
customer_reviews.author: LoneStarDigital

customer_reviews.title: I Like It
customer_reviews.text: Worked well in my standard Kreg jig set-up. Made some nice pocket holes in 2 x 4 and 2 x 6 lumber. However, the foot that goes on the end for use away from the bench does not fit. It is a tapered fit and the tapers do not match well. It binds well before it should. It will need considerable filing if I'm ever to use it. Also there were burrs in the drilling holes that I noticed when I tried sticking the drill in it with my hand. A few forced twists on the drill cleared them. However, it does demonstrate a slight lack of quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bigger IS Better
customer_reviews.text: As tools go, this is an excellent one. The reason it doesn't rate five stars is, I think it's over priced. That being said, there is only one place you can get this tool, and that's from Kreg. I own numerous Kreg tools, and like the others, this one is well thought out and well made. The difference between this setup and the largest screw size in the regular Kreg setup is substantial. The whole screw is larger, and the washer head is larger, making a tightly pulled together joint. The Screw has what appears to be a quite durable coating. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Myrick

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic tool, but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tool, but it's definitely overpriced for what you get. The manufacturing costs for the included parts are easily less then $15, yet you're paying more than 4x that. The required Kreg fasteners aren't cheap either, but are not prohibitively expensive either. I don't regret buying it, but I wish Kreg had some more competition in this space to drive down the prices a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kelch

customer_reviews.title: Solid Kreg jig for heavy jobs
customer_reviews.text: If you’re familiar with the identical (smalker) pocket hole jig Kreg markets for indoor cabinetry, then you’re familiar with this one as well. It’s just the beefier big brother of the original. If you’re contemplating a new deck or anything else with 2x lumber, get one. It’ll pay for itself the first day (even if you’re working for yourself)!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Works well for 2x4 applications
customer_reviews.text: Screws are heavy duty, Jig works well. I don't use impact driver per other comments so not to wear out the expensive square drive bit. Also take care not to use the drill bit where it could hit another nail or screw. Again the bit is expensive to replace. The joints seem quite strong.
customer_reviews.author: WI bob

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good so far
customer_reviews.text: I’m about 25% of the way through a raised garden bed project. Using with the face clamp is not practical if your project has more than four boards. I picked up the k4 jig at a local box store and mounted it to my workbench. FAR superior with the jig. 12v cordless produces quite a bit of tear out around the pocket holes. 18v is better but still some tear out. I was surprised the HD kit does not have a metal face against the wood like the regular version.
customer_reviews.author: ElectroAviator

customer_reviews.title: A godsend...
customer_reviews.text: From a home woodworker and DIYer who is woefully inadequate at "toenailing", this jig was the answer! I just finished using it to put in a skeleton wall in my open carport and this made things simple. And the end result? Strong and square. I'm currently using it on my deck railings and it couldn't be easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: The KJHD is really easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I happened upon the Kreg KJHD system while searching for a more polished solution than the toe-in screw approach I had been using to fasten 2x4 and 4x4s. The KJHD is really easy to use, especially when paired with a. I recently built a small workbench for my kids using the KJHD and these screws -->. The resulting join was solid and clean. Kudos to Kreg for such a simple but effective product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Great tool...but a handful of loose parts...
customer_reviews.text: Love it for 2x4 and 2x6 work. Works fantastic. My only negative remark is both the HD and the R3 jigs are blister packed with no box or pouch, so you end up with a hand full of loose parts and screws with no way to organize them or contain them. I'd gladly pay five or ten more dollars for a nice little wood box to organize and keep them safely. I'd rather not spend my valuable time having to make one...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tip of the bit broke off within the first 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I normally love Kreg Tools. This was the first bad experience I have had with any of their products. I bought the HD Jig for my larger furniture pieces and was excited to use it. However, the tip of the big broke off within the first 5 minutes of use. While drilling my 12th pocket hole, the tip snapped off, leaving my project on hold for another week while the order is returned and I receive a new one. While being a small business owner, this really puts a damper on my processing time, as well as income.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for 2x4 material. Good Holding power. Very easy to use.... no wood splitting. The bit that came with this is Beefy, very well made. I was surprised at the high quality of the bit. Bought this in may 2018. used on 2x4 shelving I was building in the garage, makes such a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Hettel

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Easy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to build a workbench using pine 4x4s. The HD screws are much beefier than the standard Kreg screws. Obviously, drilling/driving the screws requires more power. So if your drill struggles with the standard holes, forget it for these. I have a Ryobi 18v and it struggles. If I ever do a lot of holes I'll have to use my corded drill. Pros: Sturdy Connection Easy Setup - only one length Cons: The bracket that goes on the back of the jig fits too tight. I'm afraid it will break.
customer_reviews.author: bcpbcp

customer_reviews.title: Theory and practice
customer_reviews.text: Joint is very strong and impressive. Bits are obviously fragile and a reoccurring thing with this bit. $20 DRILL BITS SHOULD NEVER SHEAR OFF IN WOOD!
customer_reviews.author: pbl57lsu

customer_reviews.title: “Heavy Duty” drill bit already bent
customer_reviews.text: I’m surprised as Kreg usually makes good stuff, unfortunately the drill bit already torqued and now wobbles. Not sure how as it didn’t bite on anything to my knowledge and even when drilling wood with the jig I don’t usually have it on the overdrive setting. Will be returning for another
customer_reviews.author: James Faherty

customer_reviews.title: Great option for heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: If you're familiar with Kreg pocket hole products then not much to add. Great option for heavy duty, larger projects. I have the k5 product and have been very happy with that one. If you are not familiar with Kreg, then I provide my recommendation. Very easy to use jig that provides secure and strong joints. Very easy to get into diy projects. Especially with inexpensive pine. If you plan and doing larger furniture projects or decking, then go with hd Kreg. Not cheap, but you will get sturdy projects
customer_reviews.author: andiggity

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I replaced my porch rails using this jig to attach the 2X4 stringers to the posts. It's built to last, you can feel the quality in the materials Kreg uses. It will last a few lifetimes. I bought this because I didn't think the smaller 3/8" kit would create a sturdy enough connection. I recommend using the Kreg face clamp with this as well. If anyone knows where to find 1/2" Plugs - let me know. I can only find the 3/8" ones.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: It surprised me, and I'm old!
customer_reviews.text: I had used Kregs regular Jig and loved it but I needed to do some really strong inside framing. This setup works, is easy to use and makes it possible for a person of limited talent to impress his wife, the daughter of a builder. Now you can't beat that, at least I can't.
customer_reviews.author: Annie D

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Indeed!
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm on heavy, dense plastic lumber. The HD system is a much better choice for 2x4, or in my case 4x4 lumber. The HD screws that this enables you to use are terrific and really hold well.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo

customer_reviews.title: Great for ten minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Jig works great. The bit broke within 10 minutes of starting my project. It sounds like there were some defective bits being sent out. I’m really hoping to update this review once I hear back from Kreg. I ended up having to go to Home Depot and paid out of my nose for a kreg mini (since they don’t stock the HD) to finish the job and it wasn’t up to the task.
customer_reviews.author: Shareef Oneal

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy joint, and opens up a lot of framing possibilities.
customer_reviews.text: The Kreg HD jig opened up a lot of easy framing changes during a renovation, where I didn’t always have access to the other side of an existing stud, and pocket holes made it possible to block in new pieces. Very strong joints and I expect them to last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: G. Rebholz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tool
customer_reviews.text: I love Kreg products and if you're working with 2x4s and 4x4s you need the Kreg HD. It has bigger, stronger screw for heavier wood. Still as easy to use as the basic Jig, but you do need to buy the HD clamp (or whatever it's called "bigger"). The clamp I had with my original Jig wouldn't fit when I was trying to clamp a 4X4.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase will reccomend to everyone
customer_reviews.text: This might be the best purchase ever made! My husband can and does build everything imaginable. He has used this bit for more than 3 years and LOVES it.......only complaint I have is he finally broke it and I CAN'T find another bit only. Thanks Regina
customer_reviews.author: regina daniel

customer_reviews.title: the tool you need if you're face-joining 2x4s
customer_reviews.text: as a novice "builder of stuff" who likes to build things out of 2x4s, this is EXACTLY the tool I've been missing. I kept wondering how to join boards face to face, and my contractor neighbor said "oh - you need a Kreg Jig"... low and behold - the Kreg Jig HD is the one you want if you're using 2x4s. Simple to use, and the joints you make are strong as hell. One word of warning - like an idiot, I figured I'd brush the accumulated wood chips out of the drill bit with my thumb. DON'T DO THIS. the drill bit is sharp - very sharp. Use something other than your digits...
customer_reviews.author: J. Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Very useful to give added strength to larger projects
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Kreg HD jig set to use on several larger scale furniture projects. The HD set comes in handy when you're joining larger pieces of wood (like 2x4's joining to 4x4's) as the HD system (along with the HD screws) gives the joints much more strength than if you were to use the standard jig and standard screws. What's nice is the jig slides right into the Kreg 5.0 jig base to use it that way, or you can use the included adapter on larger pieces (ex. 4"x4") that don't fit into the Kreg jig base.
customer_reviews.author: VolbeatYou

customer_reviews.title: A must for any DIYer
customer_reviews.text: If you like to build anything that needs to be heavy duty, get this! I built my kitchen table and benches with it and worked like a charm. The screws are 5x stronger at least and this thing can hande most size woods. Do not use the regular KREG JIG for 4x4's, use this one. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: CGS3

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little confused on how to use it at first, but Customer Service was great, and helped explain over the phone! I started off with the Kreg Jig K4 Master System, but was building a table with 4x4’s, which is why I bought the Kreg Jig HD. It’s very easy to use, and I love how portable it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Awesome end result
customer_reviews.text: Awesome end result, but cheaply made. Knocked my dewalt drill over while bit was in it and it bent right over. Not a huge drop either just a drill standing up on its battery and falling over. Crazy it was that soft. I bent it back by hand if they says anything about the quality of the metal.
customer_reviews.author: TRGil

customer_reviews.title: Makes using 2x4's a snap.
customer_reviews.text: If Kreg is involved it will be a great product. Used it to repurpose and old chest of drawers that was on it's last legs. Hated to throw out as the frame was still stout. Converted to an assembly table for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Laudate

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic jig for bigger lumber, just be careful buying screws as the HD screws are a completely different size and hard to find
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute beast. Perfect for 4x4 construction. Made a large double sided bench out of doug fir, and this jig made it fast and simple. My only gripe is the screws that come up in the suggested field are not the right ones, and now I am stuck with a huge box of screws that don't work with the HD jig. Home depot doesn't sell either the jig or the screws either, so that is kind of a pain. Still looking for a decent sized supply of the screws.
customer_reviews.author: JDCrae

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Huge kreg fan... have way to many kreg products. This is one that is absolutely not worth it. Needs much bigger screws than normal and had better success on 2x4, 4x4 with my regular kreg / screws.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Posner

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this. You'll love it, buy it. I already have made 4 rock solid providence benches from plans on Ana White, and 2 patio Chaise lounges from modified plans on the site all out of 2x4's. All are no fasteners shown, and absolutely solid. One thing i did though is build a basic jig so i could put pocket screws across a 2x4 edge wise making a T joint. I also used the bit in a drill press to drill at 45 across a 2x4 edgewise for the bench braces.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Best tool in my shop for building cabinets
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this jig. Makes the build so much easier and a heck of a lot sturdier. Since buying this jig I’ve bought several other Kreg tools and haven’t had a single complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Jon K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I'm not sure what people are building outa 2x4's that require concealed screws but this jig is pretty awesome. I build a lot of furniture from reclaimed barn lumber and this saves me lots of clamp time. Combine this with my Festool domino joiner and I can make joints that are stupid strong. If you are joining pcs greater than 1" thick and need a screw that won't break (I did snap one) with some serious holding power this is a wonderful tool for very little $.
customer_reviews.author: jeff2413

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for 2x6 joinery
customer_reviews.text: Good for 2x6 construction larger bit takes a strong drill to use as it fills up fast. Screws are quite a bit larger than the blue 2.5 screws I have been using.
customer_reviews.author: David Grasha

customer_reviews.title: ... the handiest construction tools I've owned and does an excellent job when making pocket joints in dimensional lumber constru
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the handiest construction tools I've owned and does an excellent job when making pocket joints in dimensional lumber construction projects. I made a solid 4' x 6' farmhouse table for my kitchen out of 2x4, and 2x8 lumber. the thing is easily strong enough to dance on if so inclined and will last for generations.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought the larger set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for 2x4s. It has an 1/2" drill bit so it is HD, but if I had bought the full set with 3/8" bit, I think it would be fine. Now I met the 3/8" set for a different project and realize my error. (You can adjust the 3/8" set to accommodate 2x4s width- which I didn't understand when I ordered this set.). Now I have 2 sets.
customer_reviews.author: Amandafarns

customer_reviews.title: Good jig, no case
customer_reviews.text: Great jig but it doesn’t come with a case like the other Kreg jig I purchased. For the cost of this item, it should come in a case.
customer_reviews.author: Deana K

customer_reviews.title: When ease of assembly is important.
customer_reviews.text: This little device is great. It allowed me to install 2x4s to 4x4s to create a deck rail that is very sturdy but easy to remove if you need to remove a section at a time. I liked it so well that I bought a regular Kreg jig for joining smaller dimension lumber. It is really easy to build with this system.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie E. Gillian

customer_reviews.title: It's SO awesome to "throw in" a stud wherever you need it
customer_reviews.text: I use it for framing & stud work ALL the time. Right now I'm using it to add blocking between studs for a tub flange. I also used it to quickly add 2x10 blocking between joists under the tub. It's SO awesome to "throw in" a stud wherever you need it, without toenailing. The Kreg HD opens up so many possibilities with 2-by or 4-by lumber. Get one. This is a tool you'll use again and again.
customer_reviews.author: MNBska

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product-- easy to use--great results
customer_reviews.text: Excellent heavy duty pocket hole jig. Easy to use with precision. Built a large platform bed using just pocket hole joinery and it is solid as a rock. Highly recommended for heavy/large jobs.
customer_reviews.author: DrBob

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Installed internal wall braces to hang a 4k tv and a few heavy wall hangings
customer_reviews.author: JoeL

customer_reviews.title: Years ago I purchased the Kreg Jig mini, and ...
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I purchased the Kreg Jig mini, and recently had a project where I needed to go a bit bigger. I'm not going to compare the two because they serve different purposes. I will say that working with the HD jig and a Kreg clamp was a dream come true. The clamp holder worked very well in keeping the jig tight to the 2" thick lumber I was drilling, and made it very convenient for positioning the jig on the piece of lumber.
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: This is a dedicated tool in that it only works ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a dedicated tool in that it only works with the Kreg HD screws but in that respect, it is indispensable. The HD screws are/ or appear to me to be substantially stronger than the regular screws. I have used them to mount casters on a rolling shelf that I made with success and ease. Heavy on the "ease" part. Much easier than trying to drill in the center of a hole and then use a lag bolt. You know, it is incredibly difficult to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with the results, joints seem very strong.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to add railings to an outdoor deck project after researching load testing on Kreg's website. I know other ways to build railing as well however they publish independent testing which confirms the joint strength for railings with HD screws. Very impressed with the results, joints seem very strong.
customer_reviews.author: S. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I want to love it, I mean it works
customer_reviews.text: I want to love it, I mean it works, in fact I can’t think of anything better for the job. Not a rip-off I can see where the money goes i.e. the custom drill bit, wrench, hardened sleeves, etc. and not even shoddy construction for plastic, but dang-it all it just feels cheap. Glad I bought it, handy tool to have around, but not a tool I’d hang on the wall with pride.
customer_reviews.author: Philip K

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: its nice and all but i wish there was a built in depth stop marking somewhere on this to make setting the collet easy
customer_reviews.author: lunchbox

customer_reviews.title: A must have for anyone building or fixing wood
customer_reviews.text: Very useful product. I have used this several times with wonderful results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect pocket joints in 2x4 and 4x4
customer_reviews.text: worked great to build rsised bed planters and a compost bin
customer_reviews.author: kevin uznanski

customer_reviews.title: Great for pocket screw holes in two by fours
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to Kreg pocket hole jig for outdoor projects.
customer_reviews.author: charles lawhon

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing. I've used it in so many places and it makes a really solid joint. The screws for it are a little expensive, but they work wonders. The bit seems to hold up pretty well too even after I hit a couple screws with it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Replacement for Toe Nailed Joints
customer_reviews.text: This is "the" tool for quickly creating sturdy joints in 2x4 stock. This is far cleaner than toe-nailing, with the benefit of not splitting the wood. I use it with 3" stainless TORX fasteners for indoor framing and outdoor fence construction.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gavin

customer_reviews.title: For the woody . . .
customer_reviews.text: If you build stuff with wood (2X4's) you gotta have this marvel . . . This tool requires planning before you start yer project or you'll find that you can't drive screws where you drilled holes - other than that the jig is easy to use . . . one more thing, you need 'c' clamps to secure yer work when securing screws . . . GET THIS JIG it's worth every dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Salvidali

customer_reviews.title: Needs more Acssesorys
customer_reviews.text: Pricey. But Worth it IF your willing to buy the acssesorys nessesary to do the Projects u Want.
customer_reviews.author: Daron Dzingle

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I needed. Kreg makes the best gadgets for woodworking
customer_reviews.author: R. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked better than I expected. Made short work of installing railings on my decks
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: This is a Great addition to the Kreg Jig lineup & works well in heavy duty situations.
customer_reviews.text: Using this for a New 300' Privacy Fence we are building. It is working as expected so far. Well made & durable. I also have the Kreg Clamp which makes it very easy to use over & over on larger projects like my fence. Can get a little clogged up though requiring tapping to remove shavings. Screws are significantly heavier duty & bigger than the standard Kreg Screws.
customer_reviews.author: Mcgyver210

customer_reviews.title: There is virtually never a day of work that this ...
customer_reviews.text: There is virtually never a day of work that this devise doesn't save me. You need to buy the clamp for it. It is most practical for 2x material (like 2x4's and 2x6's). For other size material such as plywood and 1x material, use the standard Kreg Jig, not the HD. I use the HD for remodeling when I have difficult framing situations, buid-ins, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: KJHD Jig HD
customer_reviews.text: Another great creation by Kreg! Worked perfectly on all of the 2 x material I was using for a recent project! Thank you Kreg, and keep creating more awesome products!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: HD Keg Pocket Jig.
customer_reviews.text: Added this to existing tools. Works great for larger lumber sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W Ogilvie

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I just finished a cedar orchid shade house I used the jig for that to hide screws word great.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Murad

customer_reviews.title: Great For 2 x 4 Projects
customer_reviews.text: Well built and makes it easy to build all kinds of projects with 2 x 4 wood.
customer_reviews.author: Asahi

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor pocket screw jig
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to install an outdoor deck and it worked great when attaching the deck railing.
customer_reviews.author: Al C.

customer_reviews.title: I really like that this works with my K5 jig system
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this works with my K5 jig system. I used this for building a bench with 2x4's/2x8's/2x10's and the joints are definitely beefy. When I'm done I'm sure you'll be able to jump on the bench :)
customer_reviews.author: bjjjcr

customer_reviews.title: Missing drill bit
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time. It looked like it was sealed in the original packaging, but it was missing the drill bit. Hard to drill a pocket hole without the drill bit.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle L

customer_reviews.title: A good jig for your medium size woodworking project.
customer_reviews.text: This Kreg Jig is the HD version meaning it uses the HD screws as opposed to the small Kreg screws. This is an invaluable tool if you are interested in hiding the screw holes and you are a new wordworker. Many of the more experienced woodworkers love using this because it's so easy to use. I love this jig and have used in multiple projects already. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: D. Tajima

customer_reviews.title: Great jig that does what it supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Used this Kreg HD jig to attach fence rails to posts. 300 screws later I can say it delivered on its promise. While a bit pricey for what you get (injection molded plastic and a tricked out drill bit) it is brilliant and I can't begrudge the inventor (Mr. Kreg?) his good fortune. The only thing I'm bitter about is that I didn't think of it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rice

customer_reviews.title: It's Kreg ...It's Good ...Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I really like Kreg products ...especially when Amazon can deliver the same day. This product gives me the ability to work with large wood such as 4x4 lumber and get a solid connection. It came in original packaging and all the parts and pieces are the high quality I expect from Kreg products. I recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and worked perfectly on 2x6s I used for a garden bed project.
customer_reviews.author: JeremyJohn

customer_reviews.title: Used for 2x4 bench construction as designed for.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is for 2x4 construction and uses the larger screws. I built an electronic work bench with a bottom shelf. Wow, this was perfect, I use both jigs for 3/4 in. and now 2x4 projects. Thanks, Indianapolis, In. DB
customer_reviews.author: Daryl L Brandenburg

customer_reviews.title: perfect tool for 2x4's.
customer_reviews.text: typical Kreg product to my eye - solid, sturdy, works perfectly - nothing else needed. if you buy this and use it, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RealCaliforniaCowboy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, woodworking made easy!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This nice little tool helped me build a wonderful new kitchen table. It is easy to use and extremely strong bond between the two pieces of wood. Requires the larger screws(C2X250-125 HD pocket hole screws). Not available in stores anywhere near my house. Amazon was WAY cheaper on the screws as well. I can't wait for my next project.
customer_reviews.author: The Goss Family

customer_reviews.title: Really excellent product for oversized lumber.
customer_reviews.text: I have other Kreg jigs and this one hit the sweet spot when using outdoor lumber (2x4, 2x6, etc.) If you watch many of the FYI and do it yourself programs you see the Kreg pocket jig get a lot of air time. That's because they are easy to use and provide a very strong joint without the need for glue.
customer_reviews.author: Bluegw

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing that works better for the right application. It does have more strength than the original.
customer_reviews.author: Russel Robert Paul

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Jigs money can buy but the screws can be pricey
customer_reviews.text: Making frames and doing outside jobs (decks, sheds, etc...) is a lot faster using the Kreg tool. Just be aware that the screws are more expensive for outside jobs. This is why I gave it 4 stars. The Jr. Kreg Tool works great as well for small carpentry projects and the screws are not as expensive.
customer_reviews.author: TKTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: When Larger Kreg Jig is needed
customer_reviews.text: Just what you need for larger wood projects. Especially using 4X4s. Extra larger screws can be purchased here as well. Highly recommend here...well, bc you can’t find them anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo G.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This worked great. I have only used it for one project, making a large heavy dining table and bench out of 2x material. It slid perfectly into my K4 jig and worked without anyroblems just like the regular sized one. Very happy with it. I believe this table will be significantly stronger over many years compared to using the regular Kreg screws.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it. You need a strong drill for wet wood.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb b

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Just like others have pointed out...wish I would have gotten one years ago and once you start using it you will be surprised how often you can and will find work for it. I have both the hd and standard version and use this one far more for my current projects but love both of them and they compliment each other quite well for the rang of projects that they cover. Good job Kreg!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I currently have to normal sized Keg jig and let ...
customer_reviews.text: I currently have to normal sized Keg jig and let me tell you, this HD gets the job done. I just built a 7" long farmhouse table and could not have done it without this!
customer_reviews.author: abhueter

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I got a lemon.
customer_reviews.text: I love Kreg products. This one was a letdown. Out of the box the tip broke off upon setting drill down after first install.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Milford

customer_reviews.title: So much better than other Kreg Jigs for 2x4 and 2x lumber
customer_reviews.text: So much better than other Kreg Jigs for 2x4 and 2x lumber. Holds so tight it pulled warped boards apart. Be aware that the bit gets quite dull after awhile so you'll need to purchase another if you do a lot of building. I've built five farmhouse tables with one bit and had to purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. I wont give it 5 stars because im not a fan of the screw they provide. I cant think of a reason they wouldn't just use a standard Phillips driver vs. square driver. Kind of annoying. I'll just use my own bit driver and toss the one it came with.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping addict

customer_reviews.title: Not a universal bit
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were lacking for someone completely new to kreg and pocket holes. The square bit that comes with it is not even kreg universal. I went to the hardware store and bought some more square head screws and they don't work. I assumed they would all be the same. Nope. Perhaps that is obvious to the pro, but for an amateur it's frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M

customer_reviews.title: The smaller Kreg jigs are great for smaller projects
customer_reviews.text: The smaller Kreg jigs are great for smaller projects, but this is a much better jig for joining 2x4's and 4x4's.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K.Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Stop block was not in my package.
customer_reviews.text: Please send me the stop block that was missing. I like Kreg jigs but I need by stop block which should have been in the package. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Robert Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works like it supposed to. Big (14 X 2-1/2") screws can be hard to find on "need them now" basis
customer_reviews.author: hardrock_555

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! Makes it very easy to use packet ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Makes it very easy to use packet hole fastening with structural 2 x 4s and 2 x 6s as well as other framing lumber. In some situations, it's far superior to toenailing... Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.author: Sports Family

customer_reviews.title: Great Heavy Duty Joint Tool for Large Pieces of Wood
customer_reviews.text: I love this Kreg tool. It is everything the commercial states. I got it and I was off to the races!! Already made a exterior patio table to get ready for summer picnics. Jig is awesome for larger pieces of wood. A great addition to my growing Pocket joint tools. A must have if you work with larger pieces of wood. Smaller wood would require the smaller pocket joint.
customer_reviews.author: Tara P

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased, and am becoming very impressed with the quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, Very pleased, and am becoming very impressed with the quality and function of all the Kreg products
customer_reviews.author: Frank R.

customer_reviews.title: Love the Kreg Jig products!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, husband can't say enough great things about the Kreg jigs. Great price on this HD set, too. Couldn't find this at the local box stores - thanks again Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great. Only complaint is quantity of screws and pricing
customer_reviews.text: As others, wished had bought a long time ago, works great. Only complaint is quantity of screws and pricing.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

product_meta.title: Kreg Jig HD
product_meta.description: The NEW Kreg Jig HD takes Kreg Joinery to a larger scale by allowing woodworkers and DIY'ers the ability to create wood joints that are 50-Percent stronger than standard pocket-holes. Kreg Jig HD is made to work with 1-1/2-Inch material and up so your customers can confidently build outdoor furniture, fences, trellises, guardrails on decks and more. The Kreg Jig HD is a portable Kreg Jig that was designed to be taken to the job site however, you can also use it in the shop by slipping the Kreg Jig HD into the benchtop base of the K4 and K3 Kreg Jigs. Now you have another great Kreg Jig to offer your customers and your customers have the tool they need to make stronger pocket-hole joints in thicker materials.
feature_bullets: Designed with the same tried-and-true efficient design and hardened steel drill guides
If you are framing walls, building deck railings, backyard furniture, fences, benches
The Kreg Jig HD is optimized for working with 2x4’s and larger stock
Screw specification-washerhead, No.14, 2-1/2-Inch, weather-coated, self-tapping tip
For use with 1-1/2-Inch materials and up
Works in the Kreg Jig and Kreg Jig Master System
1/2-Inch HD Drill Bit, Stop Block, 6-Inch Driver, Stop Collar included

specifications.Included Components: Kreg Tool Company KJHD Jig HD
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars525 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
